summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to USAA Federal Savings Bank / USAA Savings Bank on June 29, 2020, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and several associated entities for the period from November 1, 2019, onward. It includes a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the ongoing criminal investigation.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.role: Acting United States Attorney / Assistant United States Attorney
persons.context: Signed the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter requesting financial records from USAA Bank related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities as part of a criminal investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Named as an individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed from USAA Bank, indicating she is a central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Strauss, as the Acting U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the subpoena for Maxwell's financial records as part of a federal criminal investigation.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena to USAA Bank
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office issues a subpoena to USAA Federal Savings Bank / USAA Savings Bank, demanding extensive financial records related to Ghislaine Maxwell and associated entities.

events.title: Scheduled Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: The subpoena commands the bank to appear before the grand jury on this date, though a personal appearance is waived if records are produced by then.

events.title: Prior Subpoena Issued
events.description: Reference to a previous subpoena dated December 11, 2019, for similar information, indicating an ongoing investigation.

locations: U.S. Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, Southern District of New York, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena targets financial records for Ghislaine Maxwell and entities including Terramar Project Inc., Ellmax LLC, Max Foundation, and Max Hotel Services Corp from USAA Bank.
The investigation involves suspected felony violations of federal criminal law, specifically citing 18 U.S.C. ยง 371 (conspiracy).
The government explicitly requests the bank not disclose the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve investigation confidentiality.

The requested records are extensive, covering account documents, wire transfers, safe deposit records, credit card statements, loan applications, and online banking information from November 1, 2019, to the present.
This subpoena follows a prior one from December 11, 2019, and seeks records for the period following the production made in response to that earlier request.
